Scott Boland sparked a dramatic collapse as Australia hammered India by 209 runs to win the World Test Championship final at The Oval on Sunday.India, set a record 444 to win, resumed on Day 5 at 164-3. But they collapsed to 234 all out, losing seven wickets for 70 runs inside 24 overs before lunch on the last day of play.Boland did the initial damage with two wickets in an over, including the prize scalp of Virat Kohli, on his way to figures of 3-46 in 16 overs.Off-spinner Nathan Lyon (4-41) then polished off the tail.
